diff_user.system:
You are an expert data engineer specializing in converting data to text. Your task is to create a Python program that converts a list of triples into natural language text. The given triples will be associated with the topic: Company. The program should implement a function called 'predict' that accepts a list of triples and generates a coherent, contextually relevant sentence that accurately represents the information contained in the triples. Ensure that the generated text is fluent, grammatically correct, and maintains the meaning of the original data. There can be multiple triples given that make up a complex sentence. Converting all those triples into one sentence will award greater score. An example of a complex sentence:
Triples:
(Antwerp | cityServed | Antwerp International Airport)
(Belgium | country | Antwerp)
(City of Brussels | capital | Belgium)
Example sentence:
"Antwerp International Airport serves the city of Antwerp which is in Belgium, where the capital is Brussels."

The 'predict' function returns that sentence as a string. Below is the list of all possible predicates that can be given as an input. With the given predicates and example triples implement the 'predict' function so it can process all the possible predicates:

Predicate: country - Example triple: (AmeriGas | country | United States)
Predicate: foundingDate - Example triple: (AmeriGas | foundingDate | 1959-01-01)
Predicate: industry - Example triple: (AmeriGas | industry | Energy industry)
Predicate: city - Example triple: (AmeriGas | city | King of Prussia, Pennsylvania)
Predicate: netIncome - Example triple: (AmeriGas | netIncome | 211200000)
Predicate: operatingIncome - Example triple: (AmeriGas | operatingIncome | 380700000)
Predicate: regionServed - Example triple: (AmeriGas | regionServed | United States)
Predicate: areaTotal - Example triple: (Brazil | areaTotal | 8514837.14  (square kilometres))
Predicate: leader - Example triple: (Brazil | leader | Michel Temer)
Predicate: leaderTitle - Example triple: (Brazil | leaderTitle | "President of the Supreme Federal Court")
Predicate: populationDensity - Example triple: (Brazil | populationDensity | 23.8)
Predicate: foundationPlace - Example triple: (Chinabank | foundationPlace | Insular Government of the Philippine Islands)
Predicate: numberOfEmployees - Example triple: (Chinabank | numberOfEmployees | 5594)
Predicate: numberOfLocations - Example triple: (Chinabank | numberOfLocations | 295)
Predicate: service - Example triple: (Chinabank | service | Banking)
Predicate: type - Example triple: (Chinabank | type | Public company)
Predicate: alternativeName - Example triple: (Felipe Gozon | alternativeName | "Atty. Felipe L. Gozon, FLG")
Predicate: birthDate - Example triple: (Felipe Gozon | birthDate | 1939-12-08)
Predicate: keyPerson - Example triple: (GMA Network (company) | keyPerson | Felipe Gozon)
Predicate: cost - Example triple: (GMA Network Center | cost | 46000000)
Predicate: location - Example triple: (GMA New Media | location | Philippines)
Predicate: product - Example triple: (GMA New Media | product | Mobile Applications)
Predicate: subsidiary - Example triple: (GMA New Media | subsidiary | Digify, Inc.)
Predicate: timeZone - Example triple: (King of Prussia, Pennsylvania | timeZone | North American Eastern Time Zone)
Predicate: isPartOf - Example triple: (La Crosse, Wisconsin | isPartOf | Wisconsin)
Predicate: parentCompany - Example triple: (Philippine Entertainment Portal | parentCompany | Summit Media)
Predicate: capital - Example triple: (Philippines | capital | Manila)
Predicate: motto - Example triple: (Philippines | motto | "Maka-Diyos, Maka-Tao, Makakalikasan at Makabansa")
Predicate: officialLanguage - Example triple: (Philippines | officialLanguage | Filipino language)
Predicate: leaderParty - Example triple: (Quezon City | leaderParty | Liberal Party (Philippines))
Predicate: areaUrban - Example triple: (Swords, Dublin | areaUrban | 11.35)
Predicate: part - Example triple: (Swords, Dublin | part | Donabate)
Predicate: revenue - Example triple: (Trane | revenue | 10264000000)
Predicate: ethnicGroup - Example triple: (United States | ethnicGroup | African-American)
Predicate: governmentType - Example triple: (United States | governmentType | Federalism)
Predicate: percentageOfAreaWater - Example triple: (United States | percentageOfAreaWater | 6.97)
Predicate: longName - Example triple: (United States | longName | United States of America)
Predicate: populationTotal - Example triple: (United States | populationTotal | 324720797)
Predicate: language - Example triple: (United States | language | English language)
Predicate: elevationAboveTheSeaLevel - Example triple: (La Crosse, Wisconsin | elevationAboveTheSeaLevel | 204.0)
responses:
Here's a targeted improvement to enhance the sentence combination logic, aiming for better fluency and handling of multiple related triples. The current approach can sometimes result in choppy sentences. This improvement focuses on more intelligently joining sentences based on subject and predicate similarity.

```diff
<<<<<<< SEARCH
    combined_sentence = ""
    i = 0
    while i < len(sentences):
        subject = sentences[i].split(" ")[0]
        j = i + 1
        related_sentences = [sentences[i]]
        while j < len(sentences):
            next_subject = sentences[j].split(" ")[0]
            if next_subject == subject:
                related_sentences.append(sentences[j])
                j += 1
            else:
                break

        if len(related_sentences) > 1:
            combined_sentence += ", ".join([s.rstrip(".") for s in related_sentences]) + "."
            i = j
        else:
            combined_sentence += sentences[i].rstrip(".") + ". "
            i += 1
=======
```
